text: <@U3XNURGCC> see the boostrap.feature and the drill into bootstrap_impl.py which flows through to bootstrap_util.py.  These are under the bddtests folder.  The default behave test uses a mechanism that incorporates creating your own x509 artifacts.
<@U3XNURGCC> by running the '>behave -k features/bootstrap.feature' you will have created all of the x509 artifacts under the volues/peer/... folders
<@U0PKMSYKG> thanks for the tip. trying it out now.
hi all, has anyone tried service discovery of dockers in a fabric setup - using a tool like consul?
if yes, what are the configurations that go into the `grpc`.
Has any body implemented pbft successfully on 4 different vm each on different cloud ?
